title: King on a person oriented society - situation

content.description:
Question refers to the excerpt below.

“I am convinced that if we are to get on the right side of the world revolution, we as a nation must undergo a radical revolution of values. We must rapidly begin...the shift from a thing-oriented society to a person-oriented society. When machines and computers, profit motives and property rights are considered more important than people, the giant triplets of racism, extreme materialism, and militarism are incapable of being conquered.”

Martin Luther King, Jr., “Beyond Vietnam,” April 4, 1967
content.question: King’s ideas in the excerpt most directly represent which of the following shifts in thinking among Civil Rights leaders in the second half of the 1960s?

choices.label: Refocusing the agenda on segregation in the South
Deepening concerns about persistence of inequality
Growing support for Great Society social programs
Increasing reliance on the Supreme Court to protect individual rights

content.answer: Deepening concerns about persistence of inequality

topic.text: 8.10: The African American Civil Rights Movement (1960s)
